description: All tables related to Azure Sentinel.
icmTeam: Microsoft Azure Sentinel/Data Collection and Processing

tables.description: Alerts that were generated by security products.

columns.name: TimeGenerated
columns.description: The timestamp (UTC) of when the alert was generated.

columns.name: DisplayName
columns.description: The name of the alert.

columns.name: AlertName
columns.description: The name of the alert.

columns.name: AlertSeverity
columns.description: The sevirity of the alert.

columns.name: Description
columns.description: The description of the alert.

columns.name: ProviderName
columns.description: The name of the provider that generated the alert.

columns.name: VendorName
columns.description: The name of the vendor owning the provider that generated the alert.
An ID assigned to the alert by the vendor, to help track down the alert in the original system.

columns.name: SystemAlertId
columns.description: An ID assigned to the alert by Sentinel.
The full ARM resource identifier for the cloud resource being alerted on.

columns.name: SourceComputerId
columns.description: Unique ID of the source computer from which data was collected.

columns.name: AlertType
columns.description: The type name of the alert.
The level of confidence that the alert is not a false-positive.

columns.name: ConfidenceScore
columns.description: The level of confidence that the alert is not a false-positive. This property allows for more fined grained representation, represented by a number between 0 and 1 (inclusive).

columns.name: IsIncident
columns.description: Indicates if the alert is an incident or a regular alert.

columns.name: StartTime
columns.description: The start time of the impact of the alert.

columns.name: EndTime
columns.description: The end time of the impact of the alert.

columns.name: ProcessingEndTime
columns.description: The time the alert was received for processing.

columns.name: RemediationSteps
columns.description: Action items to take to remediate the alert.

columns.name: ExtendedProperties
columns.description: Additional data about the alert.

columns.name: Entities
columns.description: A list of entities related to the alert. This list can hold a mixture of entities of different types.

columns.name: SourceSystem
columns.description: The Log Analytics source system. Will always be 'Detection'.

columns.name: WorkspaceSubscriptionId
columns.description: The Azure subscription ID for the workspace storing this alert.

columns.name: WorkspaceResourceGroup
columns.description: The azure resource group for the workspace storing this alert.

columns.name: ExtendedLinks
columns.description: A set of link objects the can provide additional data on the alert.

columns.name: AlertLink
columns.description: A direct URL to view the alert in the originating product portal.

columns.name: ProductName
columns.description: The name of the product that generated the alert.

columns.name: ProductComponentName
columns.description: The name of a component inside the product which generated the alert.

columns.name: Status
columns.description: The lifecycle status of the alert (new, in progress, closed).

columns.name: CompromisedEntity
columns.description: Display name of the main entity being reported on.

columns.name: Tactics
columns.description: A list of adversary MITRE ATT&CK tactics involved in this security issue.

columns.name: Techniques
columns.description: A list of adversary MITRE ATT&CK techniques involved in this security issue.

columns.name: SubTechniques
columns.description: A list of adversary MITRE ATT&CK sub techniques involved in this security issue.

tables.name: SentinelHealth
tables.description: Health logs for operations performed by Microsoft Sentinel resources such as Data Connectors, Analytic Rules and more. These logs can be used to monitor the health of your Microsoft Sentinel resources.

columns.name: TimeGenerated
columns.description: The timestamp (UTC) of when the event was generated.

columns.name: OperationName
columns.description: The name of the operation that triggered the event.

columns.name: SentinelResourceId
columns.description: The Sentinel resource ID.

columns.name: SentinelResourceName
columns.description: The Sentinel resource name.

columns.name: Status
columns.description: Status of the operation, for example: Success, Failure, Warning, Informational, Partial Success.

columns.name: Description
columns.description: The operation description.

columns.name: Reason
columns.description: The operation reason.

columns.name: WorkspaceId
columns.description: The workspace ID.

columns.name: SentinelResourceType
columns.description: The resource type, for example: DataConnector, AlertRule, etc.

columns.name: SentinelResourceKind
columns.description: The resource kind, for example: connector kind (such as Office365, AmazonWebServicesCloudTrail), alert rule kind (scheduld).

columns.name: RecordId
columns.description: A unique record identifier.

columns.name: ExtendedProperties
columns.description: Additional information based on the resource type.

tables.name: SentinelAudit
tables.description: Audit logs for operations performed on Azure Sentinel resources, such as Data Connectors, Analytic Rules and more. These logs can be used to audit operations on your Sentinel resources.

columns.name: TimeGenerated
columns.description: The timestamp (UTC) of when the event was generated.

columns.name: OperationName
columns.description: The name of the operation that triggered the event.

columns.name: SentinelResourceId
columns.description: The Sentinel resource ID.

columns.name: SentinelResourceName
columns.description: The Sentinel resource name.

columns.name: Status
columns.description: Status of the operation, for example: Success, Failure, Warning, Informational, Partial Success.

columns.name: Description
columns.description: The operation description.

columns.name: WorkspaceId
columns.description: The workspace ID.

columns.name: SentinelResourceType
columns.description: The resource type, for example: DataConnector, AlertRule, etc.

columns.name: SentinelResourceKind
columns.description: The resource kind, for example: connector kind (such as Office365, AmazonWebServicesCloudTrail), alert rule kind (scheduld).

columns.name: CorrelationId
columns.description: A unique record identifier.

columns.name: ExtendedProperties
columns.description: Additional information based on the resource type.

tables.name: WindowsEvent
tables.description: Windows events which are collected and sent by the agent.

columns.name: SourceSystem
columns.description: The Log Analytics source system. Will always be 'OpsManager'.

columns.name: TimeGenerated
columns.description: The time stamp when the event was generated on the computer.

columns.name: Provider
columns.description: System Properties Type - Identifies the provider that logged the event.

columns.name: Channel
columns.description: The channel to which the event was logged.

columns.name: Computer
columns.description: The name of the computer on which the event occurred.

columns.name: Task
columns.description: The task defined in the event.

columns.name: EventLevel
columns.description: Contains the severity level of the event.

columns.name: EventLevelName
columns.description: The rendered message string of the level specified in the event.

columns.name: SystemUserId
columns.description: The ID of the user who is responsible for the event.

columns.name: Version
columns.description: Contains the version number of the event's definition.

columns.name: Opcode
columns.description: The opcode element is defined by the SystemPropertiesType complex type.

columns.name: Keywords
columns.description: A bitmask of the keywords defined in the event.

columns.name: Correlation
columns.description: The activity identifiers that consumers can use to group related events together.

columns.name: SystemProcessId
columns.description: Identifies the process that generated the event.

columns.name: SystemThreadId
columns.description: Identifies the thread that generated the event.

columns.name: EventRecordId
columns.description: The record number assigned to the event when it was logged.
This field is being replaced with EventData. Modify queries to use EventData.

columns.name: EventData
columns.description: Contains the event data parsed to dynamic type. If the parsing fails then this field will contain null and the RawEventData field will be populated.

columns.name: RawEventData
columns.description: The raw event XML when parsing fails. It's null when parsing successful.

columns.name: EventID
columns.description: The identifier that the provider used to identify the event.

columns.name: EventOriginId
columns.description: VM ID obtained from the Azure Instance Metadata Service (IMDS).

columns.name: ManagementGroupName
columns.description: Additional information based on the resource type.

columns.name: TimeCreated
columns.description: Timestamp of the origin source of events, to be filled when swapped with TimeGenerated.

tables.name: SecurityEvent
tables.description: Security events collected from windows machines by Azure Security Center or Azure Sentinel.

columns.name: TimeGenerated
columns.description: The time stamp when the event was generated on the computer.

columns.name: SourceSystem
columns.description: The Log Analytics source system. Value is always 'OpsManager'.

columns.name: Account
columns.description: The Security context for services or users.

columns.name: AccountType
columns.description: Identifies whether the account is a computer account (machine) or a user's.

columns.name: Computer
columns.description: The name of the computer on which the event occurred.
The name of the software that logs the event (applicationor a succomponent).

columns.name: Channel
columns.description: The channel to which the event was logged.

columns.name: Task
columns.description: The task defined in the event.
Windows categorizes every event with a severity level. The levels in order of severity are information, verbose, warning, error and critical expressed in numbers.

columns.name: EventLevelName
columns.description: The rendered message string of the level specified in the event.

columns.name: EventData
columns.description: Event specific data associated with the event.

columns.name: EventID
columns.description: The identifier that the provider used to identify the event.

columns.name: Activity
columns.description: The descriptive title of the event occurred.

columns.name: SourceComputerId
columns.description: Unique identifier assigned to each computer in a Windows domain.

columns.name: EventOriginId
columns.description: VM ID obtained from the Azure Instance Metadata Service (IMDS).

columns.name: MG
columns.description: The directory unique Management Group ID that is used to submit commands on this management group.

columns.name: TimeCollected
columns.description: The time stamp when the event was collected from the machine.

columns.name: ManagementGroupName
columns.description: Additional information based on the resource type.

columns.name: PartitionKey
columns.description: Unique identifier used to group related events together.

columns.name: RowKey
columns.description: unique identifier for an entity within a given partition.

columns.name: StorageAccount
columns.description: Sets the storage account access key.

columns.name: AzureDeploymentID
columns.description: Azure deployment ID of the cloud service the log belongs to.

columns.name: AzureTableName
columns.description: The name of the table where the event data is stored.

columns.name: AccessList
columns.description: Determines whether a user or service has the correct permission level to perform the operation.

columns.name: AccessMask
columns.description: Hexadecimal mask for the requested or performed operation.

columns.name: AccessReason
columns.description: The reason that access was granted or denied

columns.name: AccountDomain
columns.description: Subject’s domain or computer name.

columns.name: AccountExpires
columns.description: The date when the account expires.

columns.name: AccountName
columns.description: The name of the account that requested the “remove domain trust” operation.

columns.name: AccountSessionIdentifier
columns.description: A unique identifier that is generated by the machine when the session is created.

columns.name: AdditionalInfo
columns.description: Additional information that is provided by the source, which do not mapped to other fields, represented by list.

columns.name: AdditionalInfo2
columns.description: Additional information that is provided by the source, which do not mapped to other fields, represented by list.

columns.name: AllowedToDelegateTo
columns.description: The list of SPNs to which this account can present delegated credentials.

columns.name: Attributes
columns.description: Additional information about the event.
Events that are generated when changes are made to the system audit policy or audit settings on a file or registry key.

columns.name: AuditsDiscarded
columns.description: Number of audit messages that were discarded.

columns.name: AuthenticationLevel
columns.description: Number of audit messages that were discarded.

columns.name: AuthenticationPackageName
columns.description: the name of loaded Authentication Package. The format is: DLL\_PATH\_AND\_NAME: AUTHENTICATION\_PACKAGE\_NAME.

columns.name: AuthenticationProvider
columns.description: The identity of the provider responsible for the authentication process (can include a certificate authority, a username, a password authentication system, etc).

columns.name: AuthenticationServer
columns.description: The server in which located the authentication provider.

columns.name: AuthenticationService
columns.description: The service in which located the authentication provider.

columns.name: AuthenticationType
columns.description: the type of authentication that was used for the event (two-factor authentication, biometric authentication, etc).

columns.name: CACertificateHash
columns.description: The hash value of the certificate authority's (CA) certificate that was used to authenticate the user who performed the event.

columns.name: CalledStationID
columns.description: Information about the ID of the station that initiated the action that led to the security event.

columns.name: CallerProcessId
columns.description: Hexadecimal Process ID of the process that attempted the logon. Process ID (PID) is a number used by the operating system to uniquely identify an active process.

columns.name: CallerProcessName
columns.description: Full path and the name of the executable for the process.

columns.name: CallingStationID
columns.description: Information about the ID of the station that initiated the action that led to the security event.

columns.name: CAPublicKeyHash
columns.description: Hash value that identifies the public key of a certification authority (CA) that issued a certificate.

columns.name: CategoryId
columns.description: The category of the security event that occurred (login attempt, data breach, etc).

columns.name: CertificateDatabaseHash
columns.description: Hash value that identifies the database that issued a certificate.

columns.name: ClassId
columns.description: 'Class Guid' attribute of device.

columns.name: ClassName
columns.description: 'Class' attribute of device.

columns.name: ClientAddress
columns.description: IP address of the computer from which the TGT request was received.

columns.name: ClientIPAddress
columns.description: IP address of the computer that initiated the action that led to the event.

columns.name: ClientName
columns.description: computer name from which the user was reconnected. Has 'Unknown' value for console session.

columns.name: CommandLine
columns.description: The command line arguments that were passed to an application or process that was involved in the event.

columns.name: CompatibleIds
columns.description: 'Compatible Ids' attribute of device. To see device properties, start Device Manager, open specific device properties, and click 'Details':

columns.name: DCDNSName
columns.description: The DNS name of the domain controller that was involved in the event.

columns.name: DeviceDescription
columns.description: the description of the device that was involved in the event.

columns.name: DeviceId
columns.description: The unique identifier of the device that was involved in the event.

columns.name: DisplayName
columns.description: It is a name, displayed in the address book for a particular account. This is usually the combination of the user's first name, middle initial, and last name.

columns.name: Disposition
columns.description: The event outcome/ resolution, such as whether the event was resolved or whether any action was taken in response to the event.

columns.name: DomainBehaviorVersion
columns.description: msDS-Behavior-Version domain attribute was modified. Numeric value.

columns.name: DomainName
columns.description: The name of removed trusted domain.
Indicates whether any domain policies have been changed as part of the event (password policies, security policies, etc).

columns.name: DomainSid
columns.description: SID of the trust partner. This parameter might not be captured in the event, and in that case appears as 'NULL SID'.

columns.name: EAPType
columns.description: The type of Extensible Authentication Protocol (EAP) that was used for the event authentication process.

columns.name: ElevatedToken
columns.description: A 'Yes' or 'No' flag. If 'Yes', then the session this event represents is elevated and has administrator privileges.

columns.name: ErrorCode
columns.description: Contains error code for Failure events. For Success events this parameter has '0x0' value.

columns.name: ExtendedQuarantineState
columns.description: The state of the network quarantine process, if applicable. Network quarantine is a process by which unauthorized devices are prevented from accessing a network until they meet certain security requirements or have been checked for malware.

columns.name: FailureReason
columns.description: textual explanation of Status field value. For this event, it typically has 'Account locked out' value.

columns.name: FileHash
columns.description: The hash value for any files that are were accessed or modified as part of the event, or any files that were used in the authentication or authorization process.

columns.name: FilePath
columns.description: Full path and filename of the key file on which the operation was performed.

columns.name: FilePathNoUser
columns.description: The path of any files that are related to the event, excluding the username or other user-specific information.

columns.name: Filter
columns.description: Filters that are used in the performed event.

columns.name: ForceLogoff
columns.description: '\Security Settings\Local Policies\Security Options\Network security: Force logoff when logon hours expire' group policy.

columns.name: Fqbn
columns.description: The fully qualified binary name (FQBN) for any files that are related to the event.

columns.name: FullyQualifiedSubjectMachineName
columns.description: The fully qualified domain name (FQDN) of the machine that initiated the event.

columns.name: FullyQualifiedSubjectUserName
columns.description: The username of the user or service that initiated the event in FQDN format.

columns.name: GroupMembership
columns.description: The list of group SIDs which logged account belongs to (member of). Event Viewer automatically tries to resolve SIDs and show the account name. If the SID cannot be resolved, you will see the source data in the event.

columns.name: HandleId
columns.description: Hexadecimal value of a handle to Object Name. This field can be used for correlation with other events.

columns.name: HardwareIds
columns.description: 'Hardware Ids' attribute of device. To see device properties, start Device Manager, open specific device properties, and click 'Details':

columns.name: HomeDirectory
columns.description: User's home directory. If homeDrive attribute is set and specifies a drive letter, homeDirectory should be a UNC path. The path must be a network UNC of the form \\Server\Share\Directory.

columns.name: HomePath
columns.description: User's home path. The path must be a network UNC of the form \\Server\Share\Directory.

columns.name: ImpersonationLevel
columns.description: Can have one of these four values: SecurityAnonymous, SecurityIdentification, SecurityImpersonation, SecurityDelegation.

columns.name: InterfaceUuid
columns.description: The unique identifier (UUID) for the network interface that was used for the event.

columns.name: IpAddress
columns.description: the network address (usually IPv4 or IPv6) associated with the event.

columns.name: IpPort
columns.description: The network port number associated with the event.

columns.name: KeyLength
columns.description: The length of NTLM Session Security key. Typically it has 128 bit or 56 bit length.

columns.name: LmPackageName
columns.description: The name of the package or software component that is currently using the Local Security Authority (LSA) on the machine where the event is being generated.

columns.name: LocationInformation
columns.description: 'Location information' attribute of device. To see device properties, start Device Manager, open specific device properties, and click 'Details':

columns.name: LockoutDuration
columns.description: '\Security Settings\Account Policies\Account Lockout Policy\Account lockout duration' group policy. Numeric value.

columns.name: LockoutObservationWindow
columns.description: '\Security Settings\Account Policies\Account Lockout Policy\Reset account lockout counter after' group policy. Numeric value.

columns.name: LockoutThreshold
columns.description: '\Security Settings\Account Policies\Account Lockout Policy\Account lockout threshold' group policy. Numeric value.

columns.name: LoggingResult
columns.description: The result of the logon process.
A GUID that can help you correlate this event with another event that can contain the same Logon GUID.

columns.name: LogonHours
columns.description: Hours that the account is allowed to logon to the domain.
Hexadecimal value that can help you correlate this event with recent events that might contain the same Logon ID.

columns.name: LogonProcessName
columns.description: The name of registered logon process.

columns.name: LogonType
columns.description: The type of logon which was performed.

columns.name: LogonTypeName
columns.description: The type of logon or authentication event that is being captured by the event log (common values:Interactive, Network, RemoteInteractive, Unlock).

columns.name: MachineAccountQuota
columns.description: ms-DS-MachineAccountQuota domain attribute was modified. Numeric value.

columns.name: MachineInventory
columns.description: Information about the hardware configuration and software environment of the computer where the event is being generated. It can include different data points, for instance: the make and model of the computer, the amount of RAM or storage space available, the version numbers of various software applications, etc).

columns.name: MachineLogon
columns.description: Information about a successful logon event in the machine.

columns.name: MandatoryLabel
columns.description: ID of integrity label which was assigned to the new process.

columns.name: MaxPasswordAge
columns.description: The period of time (in days) that a password can be used before the system requires the user to change it.

columns.name: MemberName
columns.description: The user account that was involved in the event.

columns.name: MemberSid
columns.description: The security identifier (SID) associated with the user account that was involved in the event.

columns.name: MinPasswordAge
columns.description: The period of time (in days) that a password must be used before the system requires the user to change it.

columns.name: MinPasswordLength
columns.description: The least number of characters that can make up a password for a user account.

columns.name: MixedDomainMode
columns.description: The domain mode of a system or domain controller.

columns.name: NASIdentifier
columns.description: The identifier of the network access server (NAS) that was involved in the event.

columns.name: NASIPv4Address
columns.description: The IPv4Address of the network access server (NAS) that was involved in the event, if applicable.

columns.name: NASIPv6Address
columns.description: The IPv6Address of the network access server (NAS) that was involved in the event, if applicable.

columns.name: NASPort
columns.description: the port on the network access server that was used in the event.

columns.name: NASPortType
columns.description: the type of network access server (NAS) used in the event.

columns.name: NetworkPolicyName
columns.description: The name of the network policy associated with the event.

columns.name: NewDate
columns.description: New date in UTC time zone. The format is YYYY-MM-DD.

columns.name: NewMaxUsers
columns.description: The new maximum number of users allowed for a resource in the event.
Hexadecimal Process ID of the new process. Process ID (PID) is a number used by the operating system to uniquely identify an active process.

columns.name: NewProcessName
columns.description: Full path and the name of the executable for the new process.

columns.name: NewRemark
columns.description: The new value of network share 'Comments:' field. Has 'N/A' value if it isn't set.

columns.name: NewShareFlags
columns.description: The share flags associated with a resource in the event, for instance: information on whether the resource is read-only or read/write, whether it is hidden, and other parameters that can affect access and permissions.

columns.name: NewTime
columns.description: New time that was set in UTC time zone. The format is YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.nnnnnnnZ

columns.name: NewUacValue
columns.description: Specifies flags that control password, lockout, disable/enable, script, and other behavior for the user account.

columns.name: NewValue
columns.description: New value for changed registry key value.

columns.name: NewValueType
columns.description: New type of changed registry key value.

columns.name: ObjectName
columns.description: Name and other identifying information for the object for which access was requested. For example, for a file, the path would be included.

columns.name: ObjectServer
columns.description: Contains the name of the Windows subsystem calling the routine.

columns.name: ObjectType
columns.description: The type of an object that was accessed during the operation.
The name of modified registry key value.

columns.name: OemInformation
columns.description: The original equipment manufacturer (OEM) associated with a device or system in the event.

columns.name: OldMaxUsers
columns.description: The previous maximum number of users allowed for a resource in the event.

columns.name: OldRemark
columns.description: the old value of network share 'Comments:' field. Has 'N/A' value if it isn't set.

columns.name: OldShareFlags
columns.description: The previous share flags associated with a resource in the event, for instance: information on whether the resource is read-only or read/write, whether it is hidden, and other parameters that can affect access and permissions.

columns.name: OldUacValue
columns.description: Specifies flags that control password, lockout, disable/enable, script, and other behavior for the user account. This parameter contains the previous value of userAccountControl attribute of user object.

columns.name: OldValue
columns.description: Old value for changed registry key value.

columns.name: OldValueType
columns.description: Old type of changed registry key value.

columns.name: OperationType
columns.description: The type of operation which was performed on an object

columns.name: PackageName
columns.description: The name of the LAN Manager sub-package (NTLM-family protocol name) that was used during logon.

columns.name: ParentProcessName
columns.description: The name of the parent process associated with the event.

columns.name: PasswordHistoryLength
columns.description: \Security Settings\Account Policies\Password Policy\Enforce password history” group policy. Numeric value.

columns.name: PasswordLastSet
columns.description: Last time the account’s password was modified.

columns.name: PasswordProperties
columns.description: The password policies or properties associated with the event, for example: password length, complexity and expiration date.

columns.name: PreviousDate
columns.description: The previous date associated with the event.

columns.name: PreviousTime
columns.description: Previous time in UTC time zone. The format is YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.nnnnnnnZ.

columns.name: PrimaryGroupId
columns.description: Relative Identifier (RID) of user’s object primary group.

columns.name: PrivateKeyUsageCount
columns.description: The number of times a private key has been used.

columns.name: PrivilegeList
columns.description: The privileges, including user, group, or system privileges associated with the event.

columns.name: Process
columns.description: The name of the process that generates the event.
Identifies the process that generated the event.

columns.name: ProcessName
columns.description: Full path and the name of the executable for the process.
Depends on Object Type. This field can be empty or contain the list of the object properties that were accessed.

columns.name: ProfilePath
columns.description: Specifies a path to the account's profile. This value can be a null string, a local absolute path, or a UNC path.

columns.name: ProtocolSequence
columns.description: Information about the protocol used for an authentication attempt.

columns.name: ProxyPolicyName
columns.description: Name of the policy that was used to configure the proxy server for connecting to the network.

columns.name: QuarantineHelpURL
columns.description: URL that provides help with troubleshooting a network quarantine issue.

columns.name: QuarantineSessionID
columns.description: Identifier of the session where the file was assessed for quarantine.

columns.name: QuarantineSessionIdentifier
columns.description: Identifier of the session where the file was assessed for quarantine.

columns.name: QuarantineState
columns.description: It shows whether the file is quarantined.

columns.name: QuarantineSystemHealthResult
columns.description: Report that shows the status of the files that have been quarantined.

columns.name: RelativeTargetName
columns.description: Relative name of the accessed target file or folder. This file-path is relative to the network share. If access was requested for the share itself, then this field appears as “\”.

columns.name: RemoteIpAddress
columns.description: The IP address of the computer that initiated a remote connection.

columns.name: RemotePort
columns.description: The port number of the remote computer that initiated a connection.

columns.name: Requester
columns.description: The event requester identifier.

columns.name: RequestId
columns.description: A unique identifier that's associated with particular requests, such as those made over HTTP.

columns.name: RestrictedAdminMode
columns.description: Only populated for RemoteInteractive logon type sessions. This is a Yes/No flag indicating if the credentials provided were passed using Restricted Admin mode. Restricted Admin mode was added in Win8.1/2012R2 but this flag was added to the event in Win10.

columns.name: RowsDeleted
columns.description: The number of rows that were deleted as a part of a particular operation.

columns.name: SamAccountName
columns.description: logon name for account used to support clients and servers from previous versions of Windows (pre-Windows 2000 logon name).

columns.name: ScriptPath
columns.description: Specifies the path of the account’s logon script.

columns.name: SecurityDescriptor
columns.description: Information about the security settings and permissions of a particular object or resource.

columns.name: ServiceAccount
columns.description: The security context that the service will run as when started.

columns.name: ServiceFileName
columns.description: Indicates the type of service that was registered with the Service Control Manager.

columns.name: ServiceName
columns.description: The name of installed service.

columns.name: ServiceStartType
columns.description: Contains information about how a particular service should be started, whether it should be started automatically or manually.

columns.name: ServiceType
columns.description: Indicates the type of service that was registered with the Service Control Manager.

columns.name: SessionName
columns.description: The name of the session to which the user was reconnected.

columns.name: ShareLocalPath
columns.description: The local path of accessed network share.

columns.name: ShareName
columns.description: The name of accessed network share. The format is: \\*\SHARE_NAME.

columns.name: SidHistory
columns.description: Contains previous SIDs used for the object if the object was moved from another domain.

columns.name: Status
columns.description: The reason why logon failed. For this event, it typically has '0xC0000234' value. The most common status codes are listed in Table 12. Windows logon status codes.

columns.name: SubjectAccount
columns.description: Information about the account that is initiating the event.

columns.name: SubcategoryGuid
columns.description: The unique GUID of changed subcategory.

columns.name: SubcategoryId
columns.description: A unique identifier for a specific type of the event.

columns.name: Subject
columns.description: Information about the security principal (for instance: user account) that initiated the event.

columns.name: SubjectDomainName
columns.description: Information about the domain or workgroup to which the subject account belongs.

columns.name: SubjectKeyIdentifier
columns.description: A unique identifier for a particular certificate subject.
A unique identifier for the logon session associated with the subject account.

columns.name: SubjectMachineName
columns.description: Information about the machine or system from which the event was created.

columns.name: SubjectMachineSID
columns.description: The security identifier (SID) for the machine that generated the event.

columns.name: SubjectUserName
columns.description: The name of the user account that generated the event.
The security identifier (SID) for the user account that generated the event.

columns.name: SubStatus
columns.description: Additional information about logon failure. The most common substatus codes listed in the 'Table 12. Windows logon status codes'.

columns.name: TableId
columns.description: The specific data table identifier the event data is stored in.

columns.name: TargetAccount
columns.description: The account targeted by the event (user name, computer name, etc).

columns.name: TargetDomainName
columns.description: The name of the domain that the target account belongs to.

columns.name: TargetInfo
columns.description: Additional information about the event target (for example: the path to a file or folder, the name of a registry key, etc).

columns.name: TargetLinkedLogonId
columns.description: Information that helps to link related events together by their logon attempt IDs. It can be useful in keeping all relevant events organized, tracking activity across multiple sessions, and identifying the attack source.
A globally unique identifier (GUID) associated with the logon session related to the event.
A unique identifier associated with the logon session related to the event.

columns.name: TargetOutboundDomainName
columns.description: The domain that the account specified in the TargetAccount field was authenticated against during an outbound authentication attempt.

columns.name: TargetOutboundUserName
columns.description: The name of the user account that was authenticated during an outbound authentication attempt.

columns.name: TargetServerName
columns.description: The name of the server on which the new process was run. Has “localhost” value if the process was run locally.

columns.name: TargetSid
columns.description: The security identifier (SID) of the server on which the new process was run.
The user account identifier that generated the new process.

columns.name: TargetUserName
columns.description: The name of the user account that generated the new process.
The security identifier (SID) associated with the user or resource involved in the event.

columns.name: TemplateContent
columns.description: The content of the event message or notification in a structured form.

columns.name: TemplateDSObjectFQDN
columns.description: FQDN of the DS object that represents the GPO template.

columns.name: TemplateInternalName
columns.description: The internal name of the GPO template.

columns.name: TemplateOID
columns.description: the unique identifier for the template that was used to create the event.

columns.name: TemplateSchemaVersion
columns.description: Version of the template schema that defines the data to include with an event.

columns.name: TemplateVersion
columns.description: Version of the template that defines the data to include with an event.

columns.name: TokenElevationType
columns.description: Type of token that was assigned to a new process in accordance with User Account Control Policy.

columns.name: TransmittedServices
columns.description: The list of transmitted services. Transmitted services are populated if the logon was a result of a S4U (Service For User) logon process. S4U is a Microsoft extension to the Kerberos Protocol to allow an application service to obtain a Kerberos service ticket on behalf of a user – most commonly done by a front-end website to access an internal resource on behalf of a user. For more information about S4U, see https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/cc246072.aspx.

columns.name: UserAccountControl
columns.description: Shows the list of changes in userAccountControl attribute. You will see a line of text for each change.

columns.name: UserParameters
columns.description: If you change any setting using Active Directory Users and Computers management console in Dial-in tab of user’s account properties, then you will see <value changed, but not displayed> in this field. For local accounts, this field is not applicable and always has <value not set> value.

columns.name: UserPrincipalName
columns.description: Internet-style login name for the account, based on the Internet standard RFC 822. By convention this should map to the account's email name.

columns.name: UserWorkstations
columns.description: Contains the list of NetBIOS or DNS names of the computers from which the user can logon. Each computer name is separated by a comma. The name of a computer is the sAMAccountName property of a computer object.

columns.name: VirtualAccount
columns.description: A 'Yes' or 'No' flag, which indicates if the account is a virtual account (e.g., 'Managed Service Account'), which was introduced in Windows 7 and Windows Server 2008 R2 to provide the ability to identify the account that a given Service uses, instead of just using 'NetworkService'.

columns.name: VendorIds
columns.description: 'Hardware Ids' attribute of device. To see device properties, start Device Manager, open specific device properties, and click 'Details'.

columns.name: Workstation
columns.description: The name of the machine that was used to perform the event.

columns.name: WorkstationName
columns.description: Machine name from which a logon attempt was performed.

columns.name: SystemUserId
columns.description: The ID of the user who is responsible for the event.

columns.name: Version
columns.description: Contains the version number of the event's definition.

columns.name: Opcode
columns.description: The opcode element is defined by the SystemPropertiesType complex type.

columns.name: Keywords
columns.description: A bitmask of the keywords defined in the event.

columns.name: Correlation
columns.description: The activity identifiers that consumers can use to group related events together.

columns.name: SystemProcessId
columns.description: Identifies the process that generated the event.

columns.name: SystemThreadId
columns.description: Identifies the thread that generated the event.

columns.name: EventRecordId
columns.description: The record number assigned to the event when it was logged.

tables.name: DnsAuditEvents
tables.description: DNS server audit events enable change tracking on the DNS server. An audit event is logged each time server, zone, or resource record settings are changed. This includes operational events such as zone transfers, and DNSSEC zone signing and unsigning.  This table captures audit events that are not from dynamic updates.

columns.name: Action
columns.description: If a query meets the criteria of a policy, the action is the response that the policy requires.

columns.name: ActiveKey
columns.description: Signing key of the KSK's active key.

columns.name: Base64Data
columns.description: Key data.

columns.name: BufferSize
columns.description: Size of the buffer used for logging the event data.(in bytes)

columns.name: ChildZone
columns.description: Name of a child zone.

columns.name: ClientSubnetList
columns.description: The list of IPv4 and IPv6 of the client subnet.

columns.name: ClientSubnetRecord
columns.description: Then name of the client subnet.

columns.name: Condition
columns.description: Specific circumstances or requirements that trigger certain actions or policies.

columns.name: Criteria
columns.description: Criteria or conditions that triggered the event.

columns.name: CryptoAlgorithm
columns.description: The cryptographic algorithm used for securing DNS-related operations.

columns.name: CurrentRolloverStatus
columns.description: The state of the key rollover process from one key to another.

columns.name: CurrentState
columns.description: The current status of a DNS key or zone.

columns.name: DenialOfExistence
columns.description: The method used to prove that a certain DNS record does not exist.

columns.name: Digest
columns.description: A secure fingerprint, allowing DNS resolvers to validate the authenticity of the trust anchor information.

columns.name: DigestType
columns.description: Specifies the type of cryptographic hash algorithm used for generating the digest (hash) value.

columns.name: DistributeTrustAnchor
columns.description: Relates to the distribution of a trust anchor for DNSSEC, which is a secure public key that helps in the validation of DNS data.

columns.name: DnsKeyRecordSetTtl
columns.description: The time-to-live (TTL) value assigned to DNSKEY records when signing a DNS zone. This value determines how long a DNSKEY record will be considered valid before it needs to be refreshed.

columns.name: DnsKeySignatureValidityPeriod
columns.description: The duration in seconds that a DNSKEY record’s signature is considered valid.

columns.name: DnsQuery
columns.description: The domain that needs to be resolved.

columns.name: DnsQueryType
columns.description: The DNS resource record type codes as defined by the Internet Assigned Numbers Authority (IANA).

columns.name: DSRecordGenerationAlgorithm
columns.description: The algorithm used to generate the Delegation Signer (DS) record from the DNSKEY record.

columns.name: DSRecordSetTtl
columns.description: The time-to-live (TTL) value for the DS (Delegation Signer) record set.

columns.name: DSSignatureValidityPeriod
columns.description: The period in seconds that a DS (Delegation Signer) record’s signature is considered valid.

columns.name: EnableRfc5011KeyRollover
columns.description: The process of automating the update and rollover of DNSSEC keys in accordance with RFC 5011 standards.

columns.name: EventGuid
columns.description: Unique identifier for the specific event.

columns.name: EventId
columns.description: Identifier for the underlying Windows event.

columns.name: EventString
columns.description: Human-readable description of the event.

columns.name: EventType
columns.description: Type of DNS event (e.g., zone transfer, dynamic update, DNSSEC signing).

columns.name: FilePath
columns.description: The location of a file or directory that the DNS server is interacting with.

columns.name: Forwarders
columns.description: DNS forwarders used by the server.

columns.name: InitialRolloverOffset
columns.description: The initial time delay (in seconds) before the first rollover action is triggered for a DNSSEC key.

columns.name: IsEnabled
columns.description: This parameter indicates whether the policy or exception list is currently active.

columns.name: IsKeyMasterServer
columns.description: Whether the DNS server is the primary key for a DNSSEC-signed zone.

columns.name: KeyId
columns.description: The unique identifier of a DNSSEC signing key.

columns.name: KeyLength
columns.description: The length of the cryptographic key used in DNSSEC signing operations.

columns.name: KeyMasterServer
columns.description: The DNS server that is responsible for generating and managing the DNSSEC keys for a zone.

columns.name: KeyOrZone
columns.description: The signing key used for authentication and data integrity in a specific DNS zone.

columns.name: KeyProtocol
columns.description: Protocol used for DNSSEC key management (e.g., DNSKEY, DS).

columns.name: KeyStorageProvider
columns.description: The system or service that is responsible for securely storing the DNSSEC keys.

columns.name: KeyTag
columns.description: A numeric identifier for the cryptographic key used by the DS record.

columns.name: KeyType
columns.description: The type of DNSSEC signing key being used.

columns.name: KskOrZsk
columns.description: The type of signing key used in a specific DNS zone.

columns.name: LastRolloverTime
columns.description: The last time a rollover process took place.

columns.name: ListenAddresses
columns.description: IP addresses on which the DNS server listens.

columns.name: LookupValue
columns.description: Type of DNS lookup (e.g., recursive, iterative).

columns.name: MasterServer
columns.description: The primary DNS server from which a secondary DNS server obtains zone data.

columns.name: Name
columns.description: Specifies the domain name or hostname associated with a specific record.

columns.name: NameServer
columns.description: Name server responsible for the DNS event.

columns.name: NewPropertyValues
columns.description: The set of properties after they were updated for a specific policy or exception list in the DNS server or zone.

columns.name: NewValue
columns.description: The updated value assigned to a specific property key within the DNS zone.

columns.name: NextKey
columns.description: The upcoming key that will be used in the DNS zone signing process after the current active and standby keys.

columns.name: NextRolloverAction
columns.description: The rollover action performed.

columns.name: NextRolloverTime
columns.description: The next time a rollover process should happen.

columns.name: NodeName
columns.description: The node name within the DNS zone.

columns.name: NSec3HashAlgorithm
columns.description: The cryptographic hash algorithm used in the NSEC3 protocol for DNSSEC.

columns.name: NSec3Iterations
columns.description: The number of additional hashing iterations a DNSSEC-enabled DNS server uses.

columns.name: NSec3OptOut
columns.description: Indicates if the DNSSEC NSEC3 protocol is configured to allow unsigned delegations.

columns.name: NSec3RandomSaltLength
columns.description: The length of the random salt value used in the NSEC3 protocol for DNSSEC.

columns.name: NSec3UserSalt
columns.description: The user-defined salt value used in the NSEC3 protocol for DNSSEC.

columns.name: OldPropertyValues
columns.description: The set of properties before they were updated for a specific policy or exception list in the DNS server or zone.

columns.name: ParentHasSecureDelegation
columns.description: Whether the parent zone has a secure delegation to the child zone.

columns.name: Policy
columns.description: Defines rules or guidelines for managing specific aspects of DNS behavior.

columns.name: ProcessingOrder
columns.description: Determines the sequence in which policies are applied.

columns.name: PropagationTime
columns.description: Time taken for the event information to propagate. Duration (e.g., milliseconds) or “Immediate” if no delay.

columns.name: PropertyKey
columns.description: Specific property or setting affected by the event.

columns.name: RDATA
columns.description: Represents the data of the resource record that was created, deleted, or scavenged in the DNS zone.

columns.name: RecursionScope
columns.description: A specific area or set of conditions under which DNS recursion is allowed or applied on a DNS server.

columns.name: ReplicationScope
columns.description: Scope of DNS replication (e.g., forest-wide, domain-specific).

columns.name: RolloverPeriod
columns.description: Time interval for log rollover (e.g., daily, weekly).

columns.name: RolloverType
columns.description: Type of rollover (e.g., overwrite, append).

columns.name: ScavengeServers
columns.description: Servers involved in DNS scavenging (aging and cleanup of stale records).

columns.name: Scope
columns.description: The scope of the event (e.g., server-wide, zone-specific).

columns.name: Scopes
columns.description: DNS scopes impacted by the event (e.g., global, local).

columns.name: SecureDelegationPollingPeriod
columns.description: Interval for polling secure delegation information. Numeric value (e.g., minutes) or “Disabled” if not applicable.

columns.name: SeizedOrTransferred
columns.description: Refers to the action taken, either a seizure (when control is forcibly transferred) or a voluntary transfer of the key master role.

columns.name: ServerName
columns.description: Represents the DNS server where the policy or exception list is being configured.

columns.name: Setting
columns.description: Specific DNS configuration setting modified by the event.

columns.name: SignatureInceptionOffset
columns.description: Offset time for DNSSEC signature inception. Duration (e.g., seconds) or “Immediate” if no delay.

columns.name: Source
columns.description: Source of the DNS event (e.g., server, client).

columns.name: StandbyKey
columns.description: the backup key that will be used if the current active key is compromised or needs to be replaced in the DNS zone signing process.

columns.name: StoreKeysInAD
columns.description: Specifies whether the keys are stored in Active Directory Domain Services (AD DS). This setting applies only to Active Directory-integrated zones when the vendor of KeyStorageProvider is Microsoft.

columns.name: SubTreeAging
columns.description: Mechanism that affects the aging (expiration) of DNS records within a specific subtree or branch of a DNS zone.

columns.name: TimeGenerated
columns.description: The timestamp (UTC) of when the event was generated.

columns.name: TTL
columns.description: The time-to-live for the DNS record, indicating how long the record should be cached before it is discarded or refreshed.

columns.name: VirtualizationID
columns.description: A unique key to manage and coordinate activities within the virtualized environment.

columns.name: WithNewKeys
columns.description: Indicates whether new DNSSEC keys were generated.

columns.name: WithWithout
columns.description: Whether key signing key (KSK) metadata is included or excluded when exporting DNSSEC settings for a specific zone.

columns.name: Zone
columns.description: The zone related to the activity.

columns.name: ZoneFile
columns.description: The name of the zone file.

columns.name: ZoneName
columns.description: The name of a DNS zone on which the zone which the event relates to.

columns.name: ZoneScope
columns.description: A list of scopes and weights for the zone.

columns.name: ZoneSignatureValidityPeriod
columns.description: The amount of time that signatures that cover all other record sets are valid.

columns.name: AdditionalData
columns.description: Additional information not already scoped into its own dedicated field.

tables.name: AggregatedSecurityAlert
tables.description: Alerts that were generated by security products and were aggregated from a partner.

columns.name: TimeGenerated
columns.description: The timestamp (UTC) of when the alert was generated.

columns.name: DisplayName
columns.description: The name of the alert.

columns.name: AlertName
columns.description: The name of the alert.

columns.name: AlertSeverity
columns.description: The sevirity of the alert.

columns.name: Description
columns.description: The description of the alert.

columns.name: ProviderName
columns.description: The name of the provider that generated the alert.

columns.name: VendorName
columns.description: The name of the vendor owning the provider that generated the alert.

columns.name: VendorOriginalId
columns.description: An ID assigned to the alert by the vendor, to help track down the alert in the original system.

columns.name: SystemAlertId
columns.description: An ID assigned to the alert by Sentinel.

columns.name: AlertType
columns.description: The type name of the alert.

columns.name: ConfidenceLevel
columns.description: The level of confidence that the alert is not a false-positive.

columns.name: ConfidenceScore
columns.description: The level of confidence that the alert is not a false-positive. This property allows for more fined grained representation, represented by a number between 0 and 1 (inclusive).

columns.name: StartTime
columns.description: The start time of the impact of the alert.

columns.name: EndTime
columns.description: The end time of the impact of the alert.

columns.name: ProcessingEndTime
columns.description: The time the alert was received for processing.

columns.name: RemediationSteps
columns.description: Action items to take to remediate the alert.

columns.name: ExtendedProperties
columns.description: Additional data about the alert.

columns.name: Entities
columns.description: A list of entities related to the alert. This list can hold a mixture of entities of different types.

columns.name: SourceSystem
columns.description: The Log Analytics source system. Will always be 'Detection'.

columns.name: ExtendedLinks
columns.description: A set of link objects the can provide additional data on the alert.

columns.name: ProductName
columns.description: The name of the product that generated the alert.

columns.name: ProductComponentName
columns.description: The name of a component inside the product which generated the alert.

columns.name: Status
columns.description: The lifecycle status of the alert (new, in progress, closed).

columns.name: CompromisedEntity
columns.description: Display name of the main entity being reported on.

columns.name: Tactics
columns.description: A list of adversary MITRE ATT&CK tactics involved in this security issue.

columns.name: Techniques
columns.description: A list of adversary MITRE ATT&CK techniques involved in this security issue.

columns.name: SubTechniques
columns.description: A list of adversary MITRE ATT&CK sub techniques involved in this security issue.

columns.name: PartnerId
columns.description: An ID assigned to the partner who sent the alert.
Name of the partner who sent the alert.
Metadata about the partner who sent the alert.

columns.name: AggregatedSecurityAlertRuleIds
columns.description: IDs assigned to the aggregated security data sharing rules by Sentinel.

columns.name: AggregatedSecurityAlertRuleNames
columns.description: The names of the aggregated security data sharing rules.

functions.name: _SentinelAudit
functions.parameters: starttime:datetime = datetime(null), endtime:datetime = datetime(null), srcipaddr_has_any_prefix:dynamic = dynamic([]), url_has_any:dynamic = dynamic([]), httpuseragent_has_any:dynamic = dynamic([]), eventresultdetails_in:dynamic = dynamic([]), eventresult:string = '*', eventresultdetails_has_any:dynamic = dynamic([]), disabled:bool = False
functions.description: Audit logs for operations on Microsoft Sentinel resources.

functions.name: _SentinelHealth
functions.parameters: starttime:datetime = datetime(null), endtime:datetime = datetime(null), srcipaddr_has_any_prefix:dynamic = dynamic([]), url_has_any:dynamic = dynamic([]), httpuseragent_has_any:dynamic = dynamic([]), eventresultdetails_in:dynamic = dynamic([]), eventresult:string = '*', eventresultdetails_has_any:dynamic = dynamic([]), disabled:bool = False
functions.description: Health logs for your Sentinel resources.

queries.description: Display events where audits were cleared (EventId = 1102) or changed (EventId = 4719).

queries.displayName: Failures updating Office365-Sharepoint related Sentinel resources
queries.description: Display audit logs of failed attempts to update Office365-Sharepoint related Sentinel resources, with an optional filter by caller name and workspace id.

queries.displayName: Security Events most common event IDs
queries.description: This query displays a descending list of the amount of events ingested per EventId for Security-Auditing.

queries.displayName: Group Aggregated Security Alerts by Sector
queries.description: Aggregated Security alerts grouped by originated sector.
